snippet.title: Donald Trump's White House: 10 days of Anthony Scaramucci
snippet.content:
Related Story:
Related Story:
Like Anthony Scaramucci's time in the White House, this is going to be brief. It seems like there is a major staff change out of the White House every few days because, well, there is. That revolving door combined with the Republicans infighting over how to repeal Obamacare, leaks from the West Wing and then on-the-record tirades to journalists about said leaks from the West Wing makes for a wild ride. This is how it goes. It starts on July 21 ... Anthony Scaramucci is hired
Mr Scaramucci is a His appointment didn't sit well with then White House chief of staff Reince Priebus (more on that later, obviously) or then press secretary Sean Spicer. So ... Sean Spicer walks
Mr Spicer : "that it was him or me". It was him. Mr Spicer is a former Republican National Committee spokesman and a long-time Washington staffer. He and Mr Priebus are key figures for the party in the White House.
External Link:
Sean Spicer
External Link:
Sean Spicer
External Link:
Trump on Spicer That New Yorker article ...
After about a week into the job, Mr Scaramucci called . According to Lizza, the point of the call was to find out who in the White House leaked details of a dinner at the White House involving Mr Scaramucci, the President, the first lady and media personalities Sean Hannity and Bill Shine. Lizza didn't give up his source but the new White House communications director unleashed and gave the journalist lines such as: "Reince is a f***ing paranoid schizophrenic, a paranoiac." And: "I'm not Steve Bannon, I'm not trying to suck my own c**k." He also flagged Mr Priebus was on his way out. GOP senators kill their own party's bill to repeal Obamacare
John McCain returned to the the thumbs down. The final vote was 49 for, 51 against.
External Link:
McCain gives the thumbs down
External Link:
John McCain
External Link:
Trump on McCain Priebus resigns as chief of staff
As far as the Republican establishment goes, this is the mighty falling. After six months in the job, . Mr Scaramucci may have told the New Yorker this would happen, but hopefully he didn't get comfortable with Mr Priebus's replacement. General Kelly gets a promotion
Appointing John Kelly as chief of staff was seen a strategic move by Mr Trump to . Analysts also predicted General Kelly would want to bring discipline to the West Wing, despite Mr Scaramucci reportedly saying he would report directly to the President. General Kelly is sworn in as chief of staff on the morning on July 31 (local time). Hours later ... Scaramucci is fired
A statement from the White House said the removal of the incoming communications director . Ten days ago, a statement from the White House announcing Mr Scaramucci's appointment said he would "officially begin his new role on August 15". No, he will not. According to the President, there is nothing to see here ...
